text: Just now thinking about how we will need a keyboard for people to type in their email addresses. Is there a system default for a popup keyboard or do I need to consider this from a design perspective in any way? <@U026PT0D7>
oh boy, that's a good question. Let me get back to you
Custom keyboard!
(jk)
that may actually be easiest
That sounds grueling
But what do I know?

Using the OS's onscreen keyboard presents a few problems. off the top of my head: (1) the mouse cursor would show up again, (2) the onscreen keyboard would exist outside the window of the OMSI app (possibly kicking the user from the fullscreen experience to the desktop with just the keyboard and no way to get back to OMSI)
then again, implementing a custom keyboard (if it hasn't been done already) would be very intense
why is this a mac app again? why isn't there a 55" iPad?
:worried:
let's just print everything out for them
that's my solution
dot matrix printouts of news stories
I'll get to work on a postscript adapter for Trapit
perfect
<@U0260V4K1>: Question

On the reading list where users can enter/submit their email... are they given the option to open articles that are in that reading list? Or are they disabled from being interacted with? (besides removing them from the list)
I had always imaged that they were for review only. So no opening.
Ok cool. Wanted to be sure. That gives me freedom to make moves I want to make.
make your moves son!
be there in 3
